trustfund:
TF094862-Korea Trust Fund to Cofinance
            the Road Asset Management Project,TF092849-ROAD ASSET MANAGEMENT PROJECT
theme: Administrative and civil service reform,Infrastructure services for private sector development,Other public sector governance

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Road Asset Management
            Project for Cambodia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: monitoring and evaluation (M and
            E) frameworks that are useful beyond the project level need
            to employ indicators that are relevant to decision-makers.
            Use of temporary, parallel systems does little to create
            lasting and durable improvements and or change. Strong
            commitment of the implementing agency is key to success. The
            combination of supervision by local Bank staff whose
            proximity enables them to provide timely advice and solve
            problems, with the participation of international staff with
            expertise in specific areas when needed, yields good
            results. Capacity and system gains can be leveraged to meet
            broader needs.
